Text: What the hell's happening?
Word is there's a brawl goin' down.
No way, this looks like terrorism to me!
Is the king okay?

All of the VIPs have been evacuated. However, it seems unlikely
that we will be able to contain the
battle within the castle walls.
I suppose I must consider invoking martial law...
What of Perv Asshat?

He is in a coach heading to the outskirts of the
capital. Judging by his route, it would appear
he intends to return directly to Oriana without
stopping at the embassy.
And King Geerk's body?
We have recovered him safely.

Make certain his remains are treated with all due
care. And have Marquis Grant see him home.

Do you not think the ringleaders of the anti-premier
faction will move to induce a rebellion?

Our nation needs more time to prepare as well.
The darkness that has been lurking behind the
curtains of history since olden times is growing
all the more profound.

We will not enter their territory unprepared to
face them.
The two combatants slice nothing but raindrops.

Their blades leap forth dozens of times in the blink
of an eye, shredding the downpour into a fine spray
that leaves dazzling arcs in the flashes of lightning.

It is nothing short of a dance, one whose movements
are indiscernible to untrained eyes, leaving only
trails traced in water and light.
A beautiful dance of blades.
It is Shadow who puts an end to their exchange.
He moves out of range and eyes Beatrix.
As soon as Shadow takes a step forward...
he vanishes.
What?!

She is able to defend on instinct alone, but just
barely.
Gr... Hah!!!

Beatrix slides her longsword away and directs a
follow-through blow on Shadow.

It is a tremendous attack that surely must have
connected.
But Shadow casually walks past her blade, unbothered.
With a gulp,
Beatrix turns her head in his direction.
...Agh!

No sooner has she looked back than his ebony blade
clashes against her own ancient longsword.
Ugh...!

Her sword rebuffed by the impact, Beatrix stumbles
and retreats a few steps.

She recovers her balance and readies her sword
again.
However...
*gasp*
Urgh!
The collision sends her tumbling through the rain.

Being sent sprawling so awkwardly leaves her no
chance to answer in kind.

Beatrix readies her sword again, having fended off
that last assault only through luck and intuition.

There is no guarantee she can do it again. But no
follow-up comes.

Beatrix eyes Shadow where he stands, poised beneath
the storm.

(Why can't I see him move? He's not just fast. No,
there's something different about how he handles
his sword.)

Beatrix's lifetime of battle experience provides her
with the answer.

Shadow's swordplay...is natural. Of course, a swift
sword arm poses a serious threat over the course
of battle.

Even a quick swing holds some sort of "sign". Even if
there isn't one, experience can warn you the moment
the enemy attacks. As long as you're conscious of it,
you can react.

No, the most deadly blade to face in combat is one
that strikes from outside your perception. It doesn't
need to be fast. You just need to be unaware of it.
Shadow's swordplay has that instinctive quality.

His motions are organic and fluid. There's no trace
of bloodlust...no hestitation...no swagger. No one
can pick up on his natural movement.

You're right in front of me, but I can't follow your
movements, just as I can't perceive the individual
raindrops.

Beatrix is simply awestruck at Shadow's prowess.
His skills lay at the bottom of an abyss nobody
else can reach.
She prepares to embrace her defeat.
What's wrong? I'm just warming up.
Grr...

Beatrix is not confident she can fend off whatever
comes next.
However...
Wait.
A commanding voice interrupts their duel.
I will also join this battle.
A mithril sword...
...with ancient script. An artifact, huh?
Do you think it cowardly of me?
I'm merely surprised that you'd rely on a crutch...
Grr!
Shut up!
Yaaaaaaah!!!
Iris executes a violent horizontal slash.
However...
Shadow appears to her rear.
She spins around, her blade flashing once more,
and unleashes another blast at him.
Hmm, not a bad display.
*gasp*

You could probably earn a zeni or two at a festival
with that.
Beatrix strikes at Shadow from behind.

Her blindingly fast barrage leaves no room to
breathe, yet each and every slash is met with
ease by his jet black sword.

Iris tightens her grip on her sword then throws
herself back into the ongoing melee.

What kind of idiots would fight in the middle of
the city...?!

More importantly, where has that little dunce run
off to...!

Shadow, Iris, and Beatrix fight atop the coaches
clogging the rainy streets.
The jet black blade intercepts another slash from Iris.

She and Shadow move from coach to coach, filling the
air with the scream of clashing blades again and
again.

Shadow turns her blade away yet again, then shifts
his focus to the rear.

Beatrix enters his blind spot to assail him with a
fierce, spear-like thrust.
His blade parries even this effortlessly.
Beatrix withdraws rather than pressing the attack.
In that moment
Haaaaaah!!!
Iris lashes out with her blade.
She pursues even further
Hyaaaaaah!!!

and unleashes a flash from her gleaming sword with a
mighty roar.

Shadow is sent crashing into a building with
dreadful force.

The outer wall collapses and sends up billows
of dust.
Hah!!!

Iris puts every ounce of strength she has into her
next swing.
Huh..?!
Shadow blocks her attack with a crowbar.
This weapon...

Beatrix launches an attack of her own from the
opposite side.

But, as if reading their intent, Shadow twists
his body out of the way of Iris's lunge and
snags Beatrix's sword with his crowbar.
Really does have potential...!

Once he has deftly handled the two, he kicks Iris
down to the ground.

Meanwhile, Beatrix instantly shifts stances to go on
the counterattack.

Swords clash fiercely through the city streets,
scattering sparks with every collision.

After countless exchanges, Shadow and Beatrix break
apart and contemplate each other.

Iris dashes along the wall, running parallel to the
freight train they stand atop.
Haaaaah!

She springs into the air and brings down her blade
with a heavy chop.

Shadow parries her persistent slash with a light
flick and a wave of his crowbar.
Iris backsteps away from his attack.

She and Beatrix both bring their weapons back to
position.
On to the next round, then.
Try not to fall off, hm?
